content:
Happy to have feedback for the new integrations product page. Thoughts?
integrations-product-page.gif

This is amazing! A few minor thoughts:

  • Subtext could be/include "and hundreds more through hubot and zapier".
  • I think the "View all categories" might look nicer if it doesn't go all the way across the screen? Though maybe that's what things look like on mobile (and not a big deal either way, given that people are unlikely to look at this much on mobile)
  • Why does the whole categories list flash when you click on it (in the mobile view)?

• Updated the subtext.
  • I kind of agree regarding the categories dropdown, added some margin to the sides.
  • The flash is from Chrome DevTools device mode.
• "hubot" and "zapier" should be links (and "ifttt" should be there; it's more important than Hubot)
• The two "bitbucket" integrations now look exactly the same (as opposed to mostly the same)
• Enter should probably select the first integration after you type its name in the search box?
• The selection color in the left side area feels too light.
@Eeshan Garg @Tomasz Kolek can you folks take a look and post feedback as well?
@Tim Abbott : Taking a look now! :)

Okay, here's what I have noticed so far:

  • There are two GitHub integrations, one is categorized as "version control" and the other as "analytics", shouldn't they both be "version control"?
  • For integrations that have multiple implementations (such as Trello, JIRA, etc.), it would be better to have a word or two below or alongside the category about what's the difference between the two distinct implementations, like we did before. So for example, GitHub (webhook) and GitHub (services) or something.
  • When you click on a category, the integrations in that category materialize somewhat abruptly, would it be possible to have some kind of "looming" transition that's smoother and makes them appear a bit softly? (please excuse my poor choice of words, I am not well-versed in frontend or design terminology)
Yeah, those are all good thoughts. @Jack Zhang FYI.
Thanks for the feedback, almost done making changes
@Eeshan Garg The current categories are just dummy data for display. Agreed that both Github integrations should (obviously :P ) go under version control, though.

With displaying the filtered integrations / search results my intention was to keep it snappy and instantaneous, kind of similar to autocomplete fields. Though I don't mind adding a bit of transition in, agreed that it might be a smooth touch :)
@Jack Zhang: I think a mild transition will look cool. I felt like it was a bit too snappy, that's all. :)
Doesn't have to be too elaborate, just a hint of it would be nice! :)
If you want to keep it snappy, a way I can think of to do that would be to have them slide into view real quick.
